intro: Ormocarpum gillettii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
